Today‚Äôs top news: Crypto majors crash on Thursday as BTC hits $60k before rebounding HYPE / BTC hits new ATH as Hyperliquid‚Äôs token holds strong JPMorgan says BTC could be a stronger play than Gold now post-selloff Polymarket‚Äôs parent company filed a trademark for $POLY, outlines token plans Rainbow Wallet‚Äôs RNBW token debuts at $34M fdv üìâ Bitcoin Erases Trump Pump Bitcoin crashed to $60,000 on Thursday. Erasing every gain since Trump‚Äôs election and completing a full 50% drawdown from October‚Äôs $126,000 all-time high. üìå What Happened Bitcoin plunged 14% in a single day , triggering over $2B in crypto liquidations and sending the Fear & Greed Index to 5 ‚Äúextreme fear‚Äù territory, a level not seen in several years. The selling accelerated through the session, with BTC briefly touching $60,000 before a modest bounce ($66,000 this morning). The carnage wasn‚Äôt contained to spot. Over $1.1B in Bitcoin derivatives alone were liquidated. XRP led altcoin losses , down 20%+, while Ethereum fell 15% to $1,750 and Solana cratered to $69. This all played out while Strategy reported a $12.4 billion Q4 loss Thursday afternoon, with MSTR shares hitting an 18-month low at $107 - down 76% from last year‚Äôs peak. Bitcoin dipped below Strategy‚Äôs $76,000 average cost basis earlier this week, putting the company‚Äôs 713,502 BTC holdings ($45B) underwater for the first time since 2023. Meanwhile, Stifel analysts warned that BTC could fall as low as $38,000 if headwinds persist. On Myriad, traders are putting a 65% chance on Bitcoin hitting $55K before $84K. üó£Ô∏è What They‚Äôre Saying ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs clear the crypto market is now in full capitulation mode,‚Äù said Nic Puckrin of Coin Bureau. ‚ÄúThis is no longer a short-term correction, but a transition from distribution to reset - and these typically take months, not weeks.‚Äù Strategy CFO Andrew Kang tried to steady nerves on the earnings call: ‚ÄúOur strategy is built for the long term. It‚Äôs built to withstand short-term price volatility, even extreme conditions like we‚Äôre seeing today.‚Äù üß† Why It Matters There‚Äôs no sugar coating it‚Äîthis is a rough stretch for crypto. Here are some of the leading takes and narratives on why crypto has been underperforming: Gold won. It was supposed to be Bitcoin‚Äôs moment (dollar doubt, sovereign stress) but capital fled to gold instead. Makes it much harder to believe the ‚Äúdigital gold‚Äù narrative. AI is eating crypto‚Äôs lunch. Mindshare, talent, and capital are all flowing to AI. If you have cheap power, why mine BTC when you could build a data center? The Trump bet imploded. Crypto traded as a Trump proxy and his approval rating is at lows. Regulatory progress could reverse. Institutional adoption isn‚Äôt helping tokens. Wall Street loves stablecoins, RWAs and tokenization - but value isn‚Äôt accruing to ETH, SOL, or existing networks. DATs are now a liability. Treasury companies below NAV invite activists to liquidate underlying BTC / DAT tokens. No excuses left. The double-edged sword of the crypto-positive Trump admin - now we can‚Äôt blame hostile regulators for the pain. We‚Äôre not early anymore. ETFs exist. Zero barriers. Fully mainstream. And prices are still down. There are plenty of other reasons to help cope with pain and describe why price action is bad, but that‚Äôs enough for today. So where does this leave us? In the ‚Äústress zone‚Äù where long-term holders historically accumulate and short-term holders panic. I‚Äôm personally getting texts from ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs going on with crypto?‚Äù - typically a sign that we‚Äôre near a bottom (local at least). It‚Äôs hard to predict near-term price action and I certainly don‚Äôt have a crystal ball. But $60k seems much more likely to be closer to the bottom than the top. We will find out soon enough. üåé Macro Crypto and Markets Crypto majors are very red another 5-8% after another brutal selloff that saw BTC go to $60k; BTC -5% at $66.3K; ETH -7% at $1,920; SOL -9% at $82; XRP +1% at ~$1.37 QNT (+5%), HYPE (+4%) and FLR (+7%) led top movers The HYPE / BTC ratio hit a new ATH as Hyperliquid held strong during the Bitcoin crash JPMorgan said Bitcoin could be ‚Äúmore attractive‚Äù than gold over time as a store of value, despite the current rout Bitcoin mining stocks are approaching crisis as BTC trades near the $60K-$80K production cost range; mining difficulty expected to drop 13% Saturday. Gemini is cutting 25% of staff and exiting UK, EU, and Australia; accounts close Apr 6 Corporate Treasuries & ETFs The BTC ETFs saw $434M in net outflows while the ETH ETFs saw $80M Strategy reported a $12.4B Q4 loss as BTC fell below its $76K average cost; MSTR down 76% from November peak Tom Lee‚Äôs BitMine hit a 7-month stock low with $8B in unrealized losses on its Ethereum holdings Meme Coin Tracker Meme majors were mostly red down 3-5%; DOGE -5%, SHIB -4%, PEPE -5%, TRUMP -17%, FARTCOIN -3% BigTrout (+88%), arc (+23%), Buttcoin (+43%) and WhiteWhale (+30%) were notable movers üí∞ Token, Airdrop & Protocol Tracker Polymarket‚Äôs parent compan y filed a trademark for POLY and $POLY, including plans for a token Rainbow‚Äôs RNBW token opened at a $34M fdv in its first day of trading ($7M market cap) üöö What is happening in NFTs?
